image.altText: A young man skates at a skate park.

props.synopsis: Outdated and forgotten skate parks in the NT forced skaters to build their own underground spot. After years of neglect, experts ask why a region struggling with youth crime can't maintain one of the simplest crime prevention tools there is.

title.children: Skate parks are low-cost, high-value — but Darwin's are virtually unusable

image.altText: Four men stand in front of outback pub

props.synopsis: Northern Territory government backbenchers charge taxpayers thousands of dollars in travel as "assistant ministers", a role not officially recognised by the parliament.

title.children: 'Gammon' assistant minister roles rack up travel costs on public purse

image.altText: A checkout stacked with groceries including tomato sauce and shampoo

props.synopsis: Independent wholesale distributors are calling on the federal government to reconsider the $50 million food subsidy scheme for remote stores that rolled out on July 1 of this year.

title.children: Remote food subsidy scheme accused of creating a monopoly

image.altText: A woman in a black blazer and green shirt stands against a white wall.

props.synopsis: A seven-day Federal Court defamation case, alleging Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price "trampled" the reputation of an NT land council leader, has begun in Darwin.

title.children: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price faces defamation case in Federal Court

image.altText: A sign for the Alice Springs Hospital, out the front of the healthcare facility

props.synopsis: NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is investigating the death of a 33-year-old Alice Springs mother of three who was unable to be revived after repeated medical sedations in 2023.

title.children: Coroner probes death of psychiatric patient who was repeatedly sedated

image.altText: Portrait of a woman in the botanic gardens.

props.synopsis: Being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis can often be an isolating experience, and even more so for those in Darwin who lack access to on-the-ground supports. Despite these barriers, a group of local women have created a support group to help fill the service gap.

title.children: Multiple sclerosis support group tries to fill gaps as NT services dwindle

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal children with white paint, red clothing, with an adult man who is also wearing a hat, dancing together.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners of the remote NT Aboriginal community of Wadeye say the community has been brought "together as one family" at this year's Yidiyi cultural festival.

title.children: Cultural festival brings Aboriginal community together after conflict

image.altText: A white man in police uniform standing next to a white woman to his right, wearing navy blue dress, standing in front of mics

props.synopsis: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says the Country Liberal Party's tough-on-crime approach "is working". But after two teens broke into a play centre and left a trail of destruction, operator Steve Mason is not convinced.

title.children: Business owner says he doesn't believe crime has gone down in the NT

image.altText: man with jaw length curly hair, mustache and goatee wearing red hoodie leans against a fence separating seats from a footy oval.

props.synopsis: Proud Gamilaroi man and TV presenter Tony Armstrong has felt the sting of racist trolling online. Now he's using it as ammunition as he tackles racism in sport in the new documentary series End Game.

title.children: How Tony Armstrong's experience of racist trolling inspired series

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas gestures with his hand in front of a crowd inside a kindergarten classroom

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas says the US president's comments endorsing the AUKUS pact were the "words we have been looking for". Follow live.

title.children: Trump's AUKUS remarks the 'words we have been looking for': SA premier

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A quick recap of Barnaby Joyce's presser
Ley pleased to see future of AUKUS assured
Joyce remains a member of Nationals

image.altText: A man in a suit with an apprehensive face arrives at a court house

props.synopsis: Former South Australian MP Troy Bell will spend at least two-and-half years in jail for stealing more than $430,000 in public money meant for not-for-profit education organisations.

title.children: Former SA MP Troy Bell jailed for fraud offending

image.altText: Two cabinets at the centre of the gallery are highlighted.

props.synopsis: As French authorities scour Europe for some of their nation's most prized possessions, closer inspection of the Louvre museum itself reveals just how vulnerable it was to the type of attack that saw some of the French crown jewels disappear.

title.children: Power tools and a 'perfect storm': How France lost its treasure

image.altText: Virignia Data centre

props.synopsis: Amazon says its cloud computing unit at a US data centre has largely contained the fallout of a worldwide outage but some services are still reportedly disrupted.

title.children: Amazon's AWS nears recovery after major outage worldwide

image.altText: Two men use the backs of their hands to wipe tears from their eyes at a burial for Ahmad Abu Mteir killed in an Israel strike on

props.synopsis: US officials travel to Israel as new strikes threaten to unravel progress towards achieving peace in Gaza.

title.children: US steps up diplomacy as Israeli strikes test Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A map of Australia with markers and a search field with the words 'your place' inside it.

props.synopsis: Ancient First Nations stories are all around us — if you know where to look.

title.children: Ancient Australia mapped: What Deep Time stories are near you?

image.altText: A physical bank card is being locked up with a lock.

props.synopsis: In recent months, there's been a growing focus on private credit, the alter ego of private equity, and the potential it may have to destabilise the system.

title.children: Could private credit spark the next financial market meltdown?

image.altText: Close-up of mother breastfeeding baby boy while sitting in living room at home.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have uncovered how having children and breastfeeding reduces the long-term risk of an aggressive form of breast cancer more commonly seen in younger women.

title.children: Breastfeeding can reduce breast cancer risk. Now researchers understand why

image.altText: A man plays in a sandpit with his four children.

props.synopsis: Homeschooling rates are rising rapidly, with families claiming schools aren't coping with bullying or neurodiversity.

title.children: 'Accidental' homeschooling grows, as families blame struggling schools

image.altText: a man touching green weeds

props.synopsis: A Lockyer Valley man has accidentally found a toxic weed not seen in the region for more than half a century.

title.children: One of Australia's worst weeds unearthed in Australia's 'salad bowl'

image.altText: Seven storey cream cement building with some smashed windows, building fence, broken signs, overgrown bushes

props.synopsis: More than half of Queensland has rental vacancy rates of less than 1 per cent, and experts say closed and abandoned properties may be the solution — especially with the 2032 Olympic Games looming.

title.children: Abandoned hotels may help solve rental crisis ahead of Olympic Games

image.altText: Man with Tasmanian giant freshwater crayfish.

props.synopsis: A creek in northern Tasmanian known to be home to the endangered giant freshwater crayfish has sustained "serious environmental harm" from land clearing and earthworks, the Environment Protection Agency has advised.

title.children: Unauthorised land clearing impacted endangered crayfish, EPA finds

image.altText: A photo of a man with red hair in a blue t-shirt looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A magistrate rejects an application by an accused rapist to prevent media from reporting on his alleged links with accused paedophile childcare worker Joshua Dale Brown.

title.children: Accused sex offender Michael Wilson fails in media suppression bid

image.altText: A man in a top hat and a coat points a stick at an enormous rectangular-shaped ox with curved horns

props.synopsis: An oil painting of an enormous cow is the star attraction at a regional Australian gallery. How did the genre of massive livestock art become so popular?

title.children: The hidden story behind this painting of a huge bull

image.altText: Sculpture by the Sea 2025 Bondi

props.synopsis: From record October heat to dangerous thunderstorms and gale force winds, the next 36 hours could bring extreme weather across south-east Australia.

title.children: 36 hours of record heat, winds, storms predicted for south-east Australia

image.altText: A young, dark-haired man smiles while sitting near a large window. He wears a dark polo shirt.

props.synopsis: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky has died unexpectedly at the age of 29, his family has said.

title.children: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies aged 29

image.altText: A man smiles at a piano in Hamilton

props.synopsis: A country Victorian art gallery has surprised local artist Hamish Elsmann with an exhibition of work he never knew it was keeping. The community response has changed his life.

title.children: A gallery quietly collected his sketches for years. Then they surprised him

image.altText: A couple embrace

props.synopsis: Joe Massa's parents, Elouise and Danny, have advocated for management changes of the Northern Beaches Hospital since their son's death there last year.

title.children: Parents of boy who died at hospital say $190m deal will avert 'heartbreak'

image.altText: A man in tan suit, glasses, grey hair and beard speaks into mic with supporters wearing 'peter george' t-shirts behind him

props.synopsis: A $100,000 donation from a sole donor was one of 212 declared by anti-salmon campaigner Peter George in his federal politics tilt, newly released Australian Electoral Commission returns show.

title.children: $100k from sole donor helped fund Peter George campaign, AEC returns show

image.altText: The casing of a missile on a salt lake bed.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners win a decision against a multinational weapons manufacturer after finding one of the company's missiles at a heritage site in the remote South Australian outback.

title.children: Maker of missile found in outback 'directly linked' to human rights harm

image.altText: A photo of a young woman and a young man.

props.synopsis: Stacey Hatfield's husband revealed the nutritionist and social media influencer died in September after giving birth to the couple's first child.

title.children: Food influencer Stacey Hatfield dies after giving birth at home

image.altText: Punnets of strawberries on a supermarket shelf, with a customer supply notice underneath

props.synopsis: Queensland strawberry growers are finishing their season early due to hot weather, while cold temperatures have delayed ripening in the south.

title.children: Weather extremes hit strawberry growers and increase prices

image.altText: A composite image of three men.

props.synopsis: A convicted "fraudster" has been able to represent vulnerable veterans, scamming them in the process.

title.children: 'Fraudster, con-man, liar': Convicted scammer ripping off vulnerable veterans

image.altText: A river with green trees growing beside it placed on orange dirt.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners and pastoralists in WA's Pilbara are hoping a government-ordered review into the usage of a significant aquifer will better protect it.

title.children: Environmental concerns over miners' groundwater take

image.altText: The ChatGPT app icon on a mobile phone screen.

props.synopsis: When Georgina Doll was looking to buy a home, generative artificial intelligence was one of the sources she turned to for advice.

title.children: AI 'often gets figures wrong', financial adviser warns
